article_text:
From Ronald Reagan’s autobiography, “An American Life” (Simon & Schuster, 1990), about taking office as the governor of California in 1967:

There were still some hard feelings toward me left over from the campaign, when I’d gone out of my way to say I thought the professional politicians in Sacramento and I were natural enemies: My loyalty was to the people, not the political establishment, and I had said so fairly...
